Award.AbstractNarration:
With this project, the Chemical Synthesis program is supporting Professor Ohyun Kwon of the Department of Chemistry and Biochemistry at the University of California, Los Angeles to systematically study the 6 pi-electrocyclizations of nitrodienes. The 6 pi-electrocyclization of nitrodienes is a new reaction that permits the highly efficient assembly of complex nitroso acetals with predictable stereochemistry and the subsequent capture of the intermediate nitronates through [3+2] dipolar cycloaddition. A key component of these studies relates to the control of olefin geometry in electrocyclizaton precursor. The new tandem electrocyclic ring closure/dipolar cycloaddition will be applied to the construction of heteroatomic nitrogen-containing scaffolds of increasing complexity, including natural product targets.

The project will provide a practical and intellectual training environment in modern synthetic organic chemistry methodology development for undergraduate and graduate students and postdoctoral researchers. This skill set can then be applied to tackling problems relevant to industrial, medicinal and agrochemistry, in producing tomorrow's scientists.

POR.DRECONTENT:
For this project, which was funded by the Chemical Synthesis Program in the Chemistry Division, Professor Ohyun Kwon of the Department of Chemistry and Biochemistry at the University of California, Los Angeles, has systematically studied the 6p-electrocyclization of nitrodienes. The 6p-electrocyclization of nitrodienes is a new reaction that permits the highly efficient assembly of complex nitronates with predictable stereochemistry and the subsequent capture of the nitronates through [3 + 2] dipolar cycloaddition provides highly functionalized nitroso acetals. While nitroolefins are extremely useful reagents in organic synthesis, nitrodienes appear in the literature only a few times and are rarely used synthetically. This project has remedied this current situation by introducing a new reaction, i.e., the 6p-electrocyclization of nitrodienes, and developing the first palladium-catalyzed desulfitative cross-coupling of β-nitrovinyl thioethers with vinylboronic acids.  This transition metal-catalyzed coupling reaction is chemoselective, mild (base-free) and results in the nitrodienes in excellent yields. This versatile palladium–catalyzed coupling reaction is also suitable for the preparation of nitrostyrenes and nitrobiaryls that can be converted to pyrroles, indoles, and carbazoles. Carbazoles are an important motif in electronic materials. Organic synthesis continues to challenge today’s chemists, requiring the development of new reactions to meet the various needs of modern-day medicine, science, and engineering. The new tandem 6p-electrocyclization/[3 + 2] cycloaddition process has shown tremendous potential to provide a means for the synthesis of complex organic molecules with useful functional groups, including amines, alcohols, and acids, that could be applied as pharmaceuticals, (agro)chemicals, reagents, catalysts, intermediates, molecular probes, machines, and materials. We have illustrated its utility in the total synthesis of pyrrolizidine alkaloids, heliotridane and pseudoheliotridane. Pyrrolizidine alkaloids possess a diverse array of biological activities, including hepatotoxicity, pneumotoxicity, and nucleotoxicity. Biomedical studies using the pyrrolizidine alkaloids and their derivatives should provide long-term benefits to society by increasing our understanding of the related diseases and potentially producing therapeutic leads.

In addition, the creative chemical research activities conducted herein are ideally suited for the intellectual and practical training of undergraduate and graduate students and postdoctoral researchers. The intellectual aspects of reaction design, the technical challenges of executing the planned experiments, the collaboration with scientists of different skill sets, and the dissemination of the research results through oral and written communications are all integral components of modern scientific education. Successful accomplishment of the proposed research objectives will require the students’ engagement and training in all of these activities. In turn, the proposed research will produce tomorrow’s scientists who will maintain and expand America’s competitive edge in the 21st century.


Last Modified: 09/16/2014
Modified by: Ohyun Kwon
